body.name: Similac Isomil Advance Soy Formula, Powder, 12.4-Ounces
features: Our baby formula is a nutritionally complete, soy-based infant formula that is iron-fortified and naturally lactose-free
Features OptiGRO, our exclusive blend of DHA, Lutein and Vitamin E, special nutrients found in breast milk that are important for helping support baby's brain and eye development
body.description: Soy-based formulas have been clinically shown to help reduce common feeding problems such as fussiness and gas. Similac Soy Isomil has nucleotides for your baby's developing immune system and prebiotics to help support the digestive system. Our gentle soy formula features an exclusive blend of DHA, lutein, and vitamin E, important ingredients found in breast milk. DHA supports brain development, lutein supports eye development, and vitamin E is an important nutrient that supports developing cells. Similac is the #1 infant formula brand fed in hospitals. Soy-based formulas are not recommended for preterm infants.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Of all the brands of soy formula I have tried, Similac brand is the easiest to use. In comparison to Enfimil and Earth's Best this product dissolved the best. I typically use prewarmed water that isn't boiling. The powder easily dissolved with minimal shaking.Enfimil and Earth's Best you need to vigorously shake and even then you may still get clumps unless you are using water that is right around the point of boiling in temperature. We should use this temperature to sterilize the powder but it should not be required to prevent clumping.The price of this formula is reasonable and actually cheaper than Enfamil. My state has a contract with Enfamil for WIC which increases the price of their products for this size can by ten dollars. I would purchase Similac powder soy formula in store but it's so hard to find. We do carry the contracted cans but they are pricey at 8-9 dollars for a can that has enough servings for a single day.I haven't noticed any adverse reactions to this formula. It's a quality product, dissolves well and is well received. Overall, I would recommend this brand of soy formula.Update March 24, 2023This soy formula, however well received it is, isn't the best. I don't know what does to make this product but it always produces a more frequent green bowel movement. Earth's best and Enfamil do not have this effect. I even got ahold of Gerber Soy which has an overall better ingredient list also.I'm still nursing and my daughter has started solids. Going back to the other mentioned brands her bowels is less frequent and more mustard colored. This tells me that Similac is full of inferior ingredients. Like ok, formula isn't breastmilk but I have to say this is the worst soy ingredient wise. It's a good product in a pinch but definitely not my first choice for a soy formula. I personally wouldn't recommend it either if other options is more available.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Overpriced for such a small can
reviews.reviewText: Why in the world does the price keep going up but not the size of the can this I the smallest can of formula you can buy but the most expensive, now it's $24.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The can is very small compared to other Offbrand formula cans that cost about the same.
